body_html:
@apaszke yes, mkl and anaconda3. MKL sees the correct no of threads available in the system. The issue is that since the backward pass was parallelized a few commits ago, when launching multiple processes 'set_num_threads(1)' has no effect anymore and each process launched tries to use all the available threads for blas ops which in turn slows down everything to a halt.

We realize now the benchmarks above are not really illustrative of the issue, we'll get back first thing tomorrow with a benchmark using 'torch.multiprocess'.
